comment.author: 69879869@N00
comment._content: I'm interested to see how these women wear their shawls - quite short and pinned at the middle back.  Styles of wearing shawls were often very distinctive, and specific to locations.  Hopefully someone will recognise this market place and reveal where it was.

comment.author: 26808453@N03
comment._content: Have asked the curator about this, to see if there are any clues (or writing) as to where the photo's image originates. Fingers crossed!

comment.author: 76331983@N00
comment._content: Wow. I love how this is shot. It's a great portrait. It made me feel I was there. Damn, I wish I was there. I probably was. Was...

comment.author: 14724469@N05
comment._content: What I really love about this shot is the fact that she is really smiling. That is so rare for a photo taken at a time when the norm was the straight almost scowling face. Very nice!

comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called THE CIRCLE OF WISDOM, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment._content: I've included her in a little video I put together: www.flickr.com/photos/bigbean/5444952555/

comment.author: 88025703@N00
comment._content: Location - Wales? Or at least, the outfit, with the high hat and short shawl might be Welsh.

comment.author: 34918130@N07
comment._content: What stands out in this Photo is not the women, but the Little girl on the other side of the Table.    She looks stressed out and somewhat in need of help.      So Many Children had to fend for themselves.     Poor Little Girl.

comment.author: 34918130@N07
comment._content: In the Square image of the Little Girl behind the table is says:  Ghost .  No it was not a Ghost, but a Little Girl in Need of something.    She looks sad and wants something to eat.
